    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context context)
        Authenticates this client as belonging to your application.

        You must define com.gms_worldwide.boxappsdk.PROJECT_ID and com.gms_worldwide.boxappsdk.CLIENT_KEY meta-data in your AndroidManifest.xml: 

         <manifest ...>

 ...

   <application ...>
     <meta-data
       android:name="com.gms_worldwide.boxappsdk.PROJECT_ID"
       android:value="@string/gms_boxapp_project_id" />
     <meta-data
       android:name="com.gms_worldwide.boxappsdk.CLIENT_KEY"
       android:value="@string/gms_boxapp_client_key" />

       ...

   </application>
 </manifest>

        This must be called before your application can use the BoxApp library. The recommended way is to put a call to BoxApp.initialize in your Application's onCreate method: 

         public class MyApplication extends Application {
   public void onCreate() {
     BoxApp.initialize(this);
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        context - The active Context for your application.
